text: I want to save a Julia plot using Plots.jl with savefig(“name”) in my source code, and my code runs, but I saw no plot in the directory of my code.  What should I do?

elements.text: I want to save a Julia plot using Plots.jl with savefig(“name”) in my source code, and my code runs, but I saw no plot in the directory of my code.  What should I do?

text: I think the Plots.jl documentation is pretty bad. Sorry about that. Here is <https://github.com/JuliaPlots/Plots.jl/blob/master/src/output.jl|the source> for plots' output functionality, which is more instructive than the actual documentation, IMO.

elements.text: I think the Plots.jl documentation is pretty bad. Sorry about that. Here is
for plots' output functionality, which is more instructive than the actual documentation, IMO.

text: You can and probably should supply an absolute path to the (poorly named) `fn` argument in any of the output functions.

elements.text: You can and probably should supply an absolute path to the (poorly named)
argument in any of the output functions.

text:
<@U019K6Q9N15>extradosages 

```fn = abspath(expanduser(fn)```
The source code of Plots.jl transforms the argument file path into an absolute one.

elements.text: The source code of Plots.jl transforms the argument file path into an absolute one.
